byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Manning, and Richard Fausset from Columbia, S.C.
byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD FAUSSET

abstract: Waters recede in South Carolina after extended storm that officials contend was one of state's worst natural disasters, with at least 15 deaths attributed to storm; Gov Nikki R Haley warns state's residents that danger is not over, with more evacuations possible as record rains rush from overflowing rivers and streams to South Carolina's coastal areas.
lead_paragraph: Sunshine aside, water was still standing in many neighborhoods, and some residents were still effectively trapped in their homes.

headline.main: Receding Waters Offer Chance to Gauge South Carolina Damage
headline.print_headline: Receding Waters Offer Chance to Gauge South Carolina Damage

snippet: Sunshine aside, water was still standing in many neighborhoods, and some residents were still effectively trapped in their homes.
